1.content:
Sokka was sitting at a table with Notai, Palluqtuq, Pinga, Sayen, Winona, Somar & Maika. Sokka was sitting there at the head of the table as he was 25 years old as Bato walked in. Smiling he was holding the carcass of a wolverine fox. He grinned as he placed it down on the bone plate that Sokka had. He pulled off a rib as he ate the cooked meat. Sokka smelt all the spices on it as he bit into it.

As for more information about the people Sokka was sitting with Notai was the first woman hunter in the past 7 decades. She had six hair loopies in her brown hair going back and joining a bunt that rested on top her long hair that was tucked in under the collar. Her eyes were brown and upon her waist was a machete.

Palluqtuq was the newest honor carver after her father's death during the war that ended 10 years ago. She had brown hair with a pair of hair loopies on the left side going to the back joining a braided tail. Her eyes were brown and her chest rather generous compared to Notai.

Pinga is the Southern Water Tribe Main Settlement's Seaway brewer and wife to Sokka. She has a blue eyes and is a rather beautiful woman. Her hair is sandy brown which is unusual and does not sport any hair loopies. Her eyes are as blue as Sokka's and height is beyond tall for a woman, standing at 6 and a half feet tall, two inches taller than Sokka.

Sayen is seaweed farmer with short brown hair and is a lot older than anyone. He was damaged during the war mentally and has chosen to live a life of not killing. His right eye has a long scar going diagonal crossing to the nose, his eye remains closed. His left eye is a steal gray which is proof of his air nomad ancestry from his great grandmother.

Winona is the first member in history to be a part of the Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar. She has chosen to have her hair short like a man's on the sides and back with a pair of dreadlocks with accent beads like the traditional brother. The only brother that does not keep this tradition is Bato.

Somar had a chicken scratch goatee and jawline beard that was barely grown. He had two dreadlocks on the left side of his face that had blue beads at the bottom. His right eye was brown and his left eye was blue. He is a member of the Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar.

Maika is a young boy that is 11 years old that has shown great maturity for his age. He is clearly Fire Nation descent being pale skinned with red brown eyes a trait found in the Fire Nation. His hair is jet black and in a bowl cut. He is the result of his mother being raped by a Fire Nation soldier during the war. He is the only Southern Water Tribe born water bender in the last decade. Katara taught him everything he would need to know, he is sometimes treated with prejudice because of his looks.

He then said to the others that were gathered, “Well, I only turn 25 once go on and dig in. It may be my birthday carcass, but I want to share it with some of the people that mean the most to me.”

Smiling they all began to dig in as they ate Sokka gave a grin to Pinga. She was just sitting there beside him with her legs folded under her bottom. She saw the look he was giving her and blushed as she then resumed eating. Sokka was so happy right now, there inside his wife was their first successful child that made it past 8 months. They had experienced many miscarriages. It would be any day now that Sokka would be a father.

Sokka enjoyed the meat as he then saw Gukki run inside. He gasped and panted saying to Sokka, “Chief Hunter, there's trouble at the pier.”

Sokka glowered as he stood up and walked with Notai, Somar, Maika & Winona to his six. The five walked as Gukki tried to keep up with Sokka as he explained, “The East Lake trading company ship sent their Earth Benders on a rampage after they were insulted by our honor. Now, their captain requests your presence for compensation for last month's tomatoes and lettuce that we paid him in what little silver and copper we had. He expected the rest and when we offered him Honor, his earth benders attacked. He wishes to give his condolences and take his compensation.”

Sokka saw the pier just a few minutes away when he stopped hearing the word 'condolences'. He then asked Gukki with as steady of a voice as he could, “What happened?”

Gukki looked down as he said with a low voice, “Brother Isi died trying to save Asa from being crushed by a boulder.”

Somar grabbed the hilt to his scimitar as Winona gasped, she was married to Isi. Sokka then said as he with his head low a single tear falling, “Winona, you of course of permission to rite of grief if you wish it.”

Winona then grabbed her scimitar as she growled with rage, “They attacked and their 'captain' could not control his men and women. I will take this earth bender's head!”

Sokka then said to Maika, “Make sure they can't leave the pier until the rite is over.”

Maika nodded as he went to gather his water benders. Sokka then flicked two of his fingers beckoning Somar to him, “I want you to find, rationally and civilly by their standards, who was the one to kill Isi. Put him under arrest awaiting rite, and then find him whoever he or she wants to either stand in for them or give their last words to. We will not have a blood bath on our hands.”

Somar nodded as he said to him, “As you wish my chief hunter.”

Sokka then said to Gukki, "Bring the Avatar, he's here in the village.”

Gukki nodded as he went to go get Aang. Sokka then looked to Notai, “Get six hunters and bring to the pier the money we have. I want it escorted, we don't want someone to steal it like what happened last year that resulted in massacre.”

Notai nodded as she ran and Sokka said to Winona, “You make one move that's unbecoming of a brother of the Whale Tooth Scimitar and I will take your sword. Do we have an understanding? You are the ultimate judge of justice and keeper of the peace. You will not let your emotions control you.”

Nodding Winona inhaled and exhaled as she calmed herself. Sokka continued with Winona on his side as he had his boomerang and space sword on him with his club on his other side of the waist. Sokka walked up to the boat at the pier as ice walls came up blocking off the pier.

The captain a skinny short man with brown eyes and hair shouted, “Hey! What's the big idea.”

Sokka then said to him, “It's just protocol when you kill one of my people.”

An Earth Bender walked out that was nearly twice the height of Sokka and nearly a person wider than Sokka. Looking like a stone chiseled to human features the man said to him with his beady brown eyes looking down on Sokka, “What's it to you, savage?”

Sokka then heard Somar walk up, “This is him, chief hunter. He refused to come along quietly.”

Sokka nodded as he heard the giant say, “So, what if I did. It's not like you savages can do anything to stop me.”

Sokka then said to him, “I don't want anymore blood shed.”

Two water benders walked up beside Maika that took a stance as water flowed out. Two of the brothers walked out as they grabbed their scimitar hilts and several hunters grabbed their boomerangs and clubs. Sokka then looked at the brothers and hunters of his people. He did not like where this was going, they were just waiting for him to give the word. Sokka had to be careful otherwise this would result in more of his people dying than the Merchants.

Notai walked up with six hunters as she presented three small bags that jiggled. Sokka then said to the captain, “This is all the silver and copper we have. Please, leave your man here. He is not allowed to leave until he has completed the Rite of Grief.”

Aang's voice rang through out the air as he shouted, “STOP!”

Aang landed as he then said looking at the group of people. He then saw the blood under a boulder near the shore. Blood was in the snow and ice looking like a red snow. He then shook his nerves off as he then looked to Sokka, “Chief Sokka, I request that you drop the Rite of Grief.”

Sokka looked at him as he said to Aang, “I'm sorry Avatar, I have no control over this. Personally, Isi was like a father to me. He was like my father or Bato, I take this personally too and if offered the Rite. I would take it. But, I am the chief as you just pointed out and am not allowed to take the Rite. It can only be offered by a person that is a brother of the Whale Tooth Scimitar, village chief or a Chief Hunter such as myself. If the victim is the grief of a brother then it falls to me to offer and them to take it. Isi was the husband of Winona and the father of three. Now, I offered to her and she took it.”

Aang turned to her as he then presented his argument to her, “Winona, I may not know you personally. But, think about this before you do anything rash. You have three children that you provide and love for. If you die too from this barbaric rite, then who will love and provide for them?”

A hunter in the crowd shouted, “BARBARIC? WE ARE PEOPLE JUST AS THE SAME AS YOU!”

The hunter walked up to be Mukka a village chief and skilled hunter from the Jagged Cove village of the Southern Water Tribe. It was one of the first villages built in response to Northern Water Tribe immigration.

Mukka then said to the Avatar, “Where were you when our tribes were suffering for 99 years of the War? And where were you last summer when the chief hunter of the Water Tribe was killed by Earth Kingdom merchants from the Omashu Merchant Trade Alliance? You were standing to the side letting these things happen. Now, you ask us to forget the death of one of our peace keepers? Without order from the peace keepers who do we trust when we can depend on you?”

Aang then said to Sokka pleading, “Sokka, you can't do this. You'll only start a war. The world doesn't need an another war.”

11.content:
Sokka then said to Aang, “I will only do what my people want. I serve them, not the world. This and the incident of last year was all started over money and our Honor not being accepted among the other cultures. And I asked you a year ago to find a way to make this happen. But, it has not happened and I told you that the next time someone dies over the unacceptance of our culture and the bigotism that comes with it. Judging us as savages and puny, that I would follow my people for they were correct and I was wrong. Well, the time has come and gone. We will let these merchants go and take the Southern Waters as ours. Any, and every ship that is not Water Tribe or approved of by me that enter's the waters of our tribe. Shall be fired upon and taken from it's owners to join our navy. This shall be in full accord in one month. So, says the chief hunter of the Southern Water Tribe. If you don't want any more blood to spill Avatar. Then, make this happen. I don't want this as much as you do. But, I am a servant of the people.”

Aang knew that this was his second chance that Sokka was giving. Sokka could have easily made this decree take place in a couple of days. But, he was giving Aang a month to fix this. It was the Avatar's job to help keep the world in balance. The massacre of last year that took 40 Water Tribesmen, the Southern Water Tribe Main settlement village chief Hakoda among them, should never have happened. And today thanks to cooler heads and Sokka's leadership, only one person died. Maybe two thanks to the rite of grief. But, Aang had to make this right, he screwed up once. He couldn't screw up again.

Sokka then said to the giant, “You need to come with us or face the entire ship to be boarded and commandeered by us.”

The giant looked down on Sokka as he said to him, “Make me."

Sokka then moved extremely fast as he grabbed his sword as Aang leaped into action. He used his air bending to make the giant hit the snow as Sokka cut off the giant's furthest segment of the middle finger. The giant roared in pain as he screamed, “YOU-!”

Aang then said to him as he water bent the giant into the snow with ice on his limbs, “You will follow the traditions so says the Avatar! Or are you disagreeing with the Avatar?”

The giant asked the tribe, “What sort of tradition is this?”

Sokka then said to him, “You fight to the death with loved one that accepted the offer to the rite of grief. Basically we take this to Cave of Light where you will fight to the death with Winona of the Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar. Either you will die or Winona will die.”

A girl on the boat moved as she leaped off the ship grabbing the railing and metal bending it into a sword. She moved at the Avatar as she said to him in passion, "YOU WILL NOT TAKE MY LITTLE BROTHER!"

Aang turned nearly too late as Sokka moved and his brother in law out of the way. Sokka had his sword still in hand as the two began to fight sword to sword. Sokka took her sword apart in less than six attacks as she reformed it each time it broke from the six attacks finally becoming more of a hindrance than a tool.

She then earth bent some plates of earth from the ship for it's defenses at Sokka. Sokka then leaped back as he defended himself. One of the hunters then threw his boomerang and shouted rallying the people, "DEFEND YOURSELF THIS DAY! FOR THE BROTHERS AND SISTERS OF THE JAGGED COVE MASSACRE!"

Sokka then knew it was too late, he knew that he either had to end this with this woman's death or turn on his own people to stop it. Aang could see this as he then realized that he had no true power. The abadonment during the war truly left the people with any true respect to the Avatar. The Avatar was seen as someone who was the judge, jury and executioner for peace and balance of the world. That's when it happened Earth came from the ship and the boulder as the Giant stood up and killed seven people as he roared. Blood every where, it was a horrible sight. Now he knew what Sokka must have felt a year ago. He really screwed up as he then water bent up a field of mist and used air bending to pull the two earth benders back. Using fire bending he warded off the pair as he then strapped his foot and moved his hands up. Ice became water and ensared the giant into a block of ice.

Leaping into the air he air bent to the top as he then placed his thumb on the giant's head. His eyes became a blue as the red energy flew out of the giant. The energy bending was completed the blue swallowed the red as the man lost his bending. Sokka then saw Aang release the giant as he said to the people, "Stop fighting he can no longer hurt you."

The man who had rallied them was a water bender of Maika's, he was Trum. Trum walked up as he then shouted, "The damage is already done, they attacked our chief, they had slaughtered our peace keeper and killed what accounts to be seven people. Bending or not he has to die now along with the bitch who helped him."

Aang then argued to him, "No, you people believe in honor and that you shouldn't kill a defenceless man. He is unarmed and has no bending, please let them go in peace."

Sokka then said to Aang as he saw the already done damage, "Any man can pick up a bone and be armed. I'll offer Winona the Rite to Grief one last time since you are so bent on having the outcome be of peace."

Katara had finally gotten there as she looked to be a few months pregnant. She saw the blood and could not believe what she saw. Katara was grabbed by a man who helped her down. She nearly vomited at seeing the dead bodies. It was just like a year ago when her father died.

Flashback

A man of tremendous build, but no giant shouted at Hakoda, "This bone and junk is worthless! If someone has stolen the money that you planned on giving me. Then I want their head!"

Hakoda then said to him, "This is Southern Water Tribe sovereignty, you will respect the judgement as I have of our Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar. He needed the money to buy medicine for his village because of the plague that has broken out. I'm sure that we will have enough money by next month to pay for the barrels of seed."

The man then shouted at him, "Next month? I am not coming back here to freeze my ass off. Either you give me my money now or I will get upset."

Hakoda spoke calmly as Katara was looking worried and Sokka was standing guard of his father. This was not turning out to be a good day. Sokka had just became a sub chief and Bato put in for his retirement. Why did this have to happen? Hakoda said to him, "What if we give you meat to take back with you? You could sell it as exotic meats and make double the money."

The man said back to him with a spit to the snow at Hakoda's feet, "Not even the poorest peasant in Ba Sing Sae would pay for your shitty savage meat, water tribe. Now, I'm going to give you one last chance. Give me the man's head or my money. I will not leave here without it."

Hakoda then said to him, "I'm afraid I can not."

The man then earth bent up a bunch of coal as a merchant threw a toss mine at it as the coal went at the chief hunter. Hakoda then pushed Katara and Sokka away as he and two brothers of the Whale Tooth Scimitar ran in to try and save the chief. Three bodies fell as the captain called for defense against the 'rabid' water tribe savages.

End of Flashback

Aang then said to Sokka angrily, "You and your people are so swallowed up by war and being treated as foreigners that you can't see the bigger picture. You have to let these things roll over and take them with a grain of salt."

Sokka then just said as he took his sword to the Avatar's neck, "I'm only doing what a Chief Hunter should do."

Katara then said to her brother, "This isn't what Dad would have done, Sokka."

Sokka then cried out as he pulled his blade back, "NO! YOU DON'T GET TO SAY THAT! I HAVE TO FACE EVERYDAY THAT MY BEST WASN'T GOOD ENOUGH! I FOUGHT TO KEEP BACK THOSE EARTH BENDERS MY ABSOLUTE BEST AND YET THEY STILL KILLED MORE THAN MY FATHER THAT DAY! I hate to say it Katara, but what Dad did that day disgraced every Tribesman standing here. I don't want this, but order must be upheld. Balance must be restored, if we just stand by and let the Southern Raiders of the world just roll over us. Then we don't deserve to hunt the animals for their Honor. We should all just go into the Ice and starve. We are Water Tribe. We are better than this. And I am a servant of the people. The people have spoken and now the peace keeper and judge of the Ice shall now lay decree. Somar, Winona and Bato as the last brothers I ask you. What is your decree on these two?"

Bato, Somar and Winona then said in their infinite wisdom and judgement, "...".

They decree that the death to the pair should be given the harshest of dooms. Option 2: They shall be spared, but Winona still take the Rite of Grief for the Giant. Option 3: Too much blood has been spilt and they agree with Sokka's original offer. One month of staying out of the water of the Southern Water Tribe unless if you have the Water Tribe's permission.

1131.content:
Somar, Bato, and Winona coldly gazed upon the prone giant of a man, and his sister as well. For a moment, they seemed to confer among themselves without speech, as though communing in thought by way of some secret, forgotten art.

Their eyes were dark, cold and impersonal like the depths of the ocean as they pronounced the Doom of the transgressors, even as had been the tradition of their people since before the Earth Kingdom was united under a single monarch, before the Air Nomads built their four great temples, back when the Sun Warrior Dynasty still prospered in the West.

"For the bloodshed which these two have unjustly inflicted upon our brethren," they spoke, the cadence of their words perfectly matched, such that it seemed they were more a single being speaking at once with three mouths voice, "and the bloodshed enacted against us by their people in the year previous, it has been decided. They must be punished, in accordance with the way of the Water Tribes. Thus do we, the appointed judges of the Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar, declare that these two shall face the harshest of Dooms."

Aang and Katara paled, both knowing full well what this meant. They looked like they dearly wished to interfere, to try and sway them from this course, but they did not make any moves. They had been chastised, perhaps, by Sokka's sharp words, and feared to widen any more the divide that seemed to have formed between them.

The Earth Kingdom merchants and their guards, however, seemed simply vexed, appearing more annoyed than anything, as if they saw no reason to fear the judgement of the Southern Water Tribe.

"And what is it, then?" said the mousy, middle-aged captain, a man who looked more a bureaucrat than a sailor. "What is this 'harshest of Dooms'?" He sounded irritated, but unconcerned -- as though he did not believe he had any reason to fear the judgement of the Water Tribe.

"The Ice," said Sokka simply, and there was a grim weight in his words. "Those who commit the worst of crimes within the Water Tribes are left to the judgement of the Ice. They are blindfolded, stripped of all supplies, tools, or rations, left with only the clothes on their back, and brought out into the furthest, emptiest wastes of the tundra. That far out, left stranded, alone, whether you live or die, your fate is left in the hands of the Ice. If it judges them worthy of life, if it shows them mercy and permits them to return to humanity, then they shall be considered cleansed of wrongdoing, purified by the cruelest of Nature's hardships." His eyes alighted upon the two accused, the two guilty. "However, if they die, then they are left to the Ice, and their names are stricken from all records, save those of their transgression and judgement. Their names are forbidden to be spoken among the tribe until they return."

"If they ever return," said Aang, and face was pale. "Sokka, you can't actually be considering--!"

"I'm not the one considering it," Sokka replied. "It's already been decided. The Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar has spoken. Even I could not overturn their judgement, if I wanted to."

Aang sighed.

"But you don't," he said, sounding weary, tired. He leaned against his staff, looking very old and worn at that moment.

"It's not about what I want," said Sokka, pointedly avoiding the question. "As Chief, I must follow the will of the people. Judgement has already been passed."

Aang shook his head.

"Sokka..." he said slowly, quietly, and the man for a moment felt truly sorry for his friend, and the position he must be in. "I understand that this is how your people settle such matters, and I will not interfere. However," he added, "I do not support this. I cannot support it. Sokka, I know your people want justice for everything that's been done..." He sighed, shaking his head. "Yet, I wonder what Justice really is..." he seemed to be whispering this more to himself.

"Justice is the Will of the Ice," said Somar. "It is not the place of men, or women, to determine it for themselves."

"Yet still you would leave them out on the tundra," murmured Katara, a distant, sad look in her eyes.

"It's the way of our people, Sister," spoke Sokka softly. "I'm not in any position to change that. It's not my place."

Katara sighed.

"I know," she said, and Sokka knew that she spoke the truth. She knew this every bit as well as he did, but she was still sad, too kind to truly accept what needed to be done. That, more than anything else, was really why Sokka had been chosen as their father's successor, not her.

And the Chief Hunter knew that his sister would never be able to really accept what he needed to do. She would never be able to look at him the way she used to.

"I'm sorry, Katara..." Sokka whispered, before turning to face the captain of the Earth Kingdom merchant ship. "Well? You have heard the judgement. Will you submit these two to the Ice, and accept that they must face justice for their actions?"

How did the captain respond?

11311.content:
The captain looked at the people that were gathered. Sure, they could take them, but would that really look like a win? The Omashu Trade Alliance already faced severe repremands from King Bumi for the massacre of the year previous. And it wasn't as if the current chief wasn't giving him an option. To prevent global crisis he looked down as he said to Sokka, "Take them, they are yours."

Sokka then moved his hand to the hunters as several surrounded them as Maika and his water benders rose the pair onto ice sleds. Katara ran up to Bato as she begged him, "Can't you give them something? We may have to follow your judgement, but even a water tribesman is allowed a weapon while in the Ice."

Bato disregarded her simply saying as he walked, "Yes, water tribesmen are permitted such a advantage. But, these people are not Water Tribe."

Sokka then walked with Notai on his six along with her six hunters as the ship left the pier. Sokka then said to her, "I'm going home to be with my wife. Send word to Kyoshi Island, that they either join us or they set up their own Navy to protect their waters. No Earth Kingdom ship or Fire Nation ship shall set sail in Southern Waters until I say so. I want this to be understood."

Notai then said to him, "Personally, I think that it's long past due, my chief hunter."

Sokka then replied to her, "I did not ask for your thoughts, I asked nothing from you accept to get word out. Do it now, I've already had a bad day."

Notai nodded as she went feeling a tad hurt by his harsh cold voice. Sokka went to the meeting igloo where Pinga was waiting sitting with hunters guarding her. Sokka then said to her cold and angry, "Pinga, we're going home."

Pinga nodded knowing that Sokka must have had a rough day. She stood up as she walked with the three hunters. She then took his hand and pulled it up to her face. She held his warm hand to her cheek as she said to him, "Take us home then and I will make sure you forget."

Sokka then said to her, "Nothing will make me forget."

Pinga then replied to him, "Don't be so quick to assume that I the wife of the chief hunter can not do my wifely duties. I shall make you forget if only for a little while. And if you don't then you won't be forgetting anything for a while and I'll take the skank leather as well. So, take us home and I shall make you forget if only for a minute."

113112.content:
Aang landed at Sokka's house as he walked into the igloo and looked at the small suspended rib cage coming down from the ceiling. It was hanging in just the right place to be shook like a door bell of knocking on a door.

Sokka heard the rattling of the rib cage as he stood up from the covers of furs. Pinga smiled with a flushed face as she said grabbing his ankle, "Let them solve their own problems or have the brothers solve it. You have duties to me."

Sokka then said to her as pleasurable it would be to continue he didn't want to strain the baby, "Give me an hour and I'll make you feel good again."

Sokka went out of the room as he pulled on a shirt and hopped while putting on some pants. He walked up the steps in his bare feet as he walked up. He saw that it was Aang as he glowered and then motioned for him to come in. Aang walked behind Sokka as the pair went into a room that was normally closed off by a door of Koalaotter furs. Sokka went to a seat made of Arctic wolf bat bones as he sat down at a table made of the three skeletons of three hunted dolphin piranha.

Sokka then said to him as he wanted to be curtous slid him a Arctic wolf bat bone chair, "Sit if you desire."

Aang then made an ice chair as he sat down and said to Sokka, "Sokka, you don't have the power to over turn the judgements of the Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar. So, I won't ask you of that. But, you do have the power to disband it."

Sokka looked at Aang as he said to him, "No."

Aang tried to argue, "But, Sokka if you don't then the next merchants will be met with prejudice. They are brothers and sisters, if one dies they all feel the pain. And let's face it you only have three left. Your population is less than 6,000 people and you have three settlements. You have made great strives in rebuilding your people along side your father. Sokka's point is a place of learning instead of just being taught what your father was taught and his father before him. Please, you don't have enough hunters and your water benders are starting to just push, and not pull. The brotherhood is small and no child has exhibited the mental abilities of one since Somar was born. And he's as old as Katara is. What are you going to do?"

Sokka then said to him, "I will trust the spirits."

Aang never saw this side of his friend before. Sokka was up against the wall hanging like a Gemsbok Bull on a wall of some Earth Kingdom game hunter. Sokka was at his lowest if he was praying to the spirits as he knew about the spirits of the world. Not just anyone became a Brotherhood of the Whale Tooth Scimitar. There was nothing spiritual or magical about it, just natural born talent. Of course the spirits did design the destiny of every child born into the world. A water bender would concoct a special brew. This brew was drank by a child at the age of 6 and produced a mind numbing state in the child. The child would then be attacked by the combined attacks of a boomerang from a hunter, three water bent attacks and kill the wolverine fox in the room. If the child could not do this then the hunter would kill the wolverine fox before harm could be done. The Water Tribe knew they were no warriors, they were hunters. And those who were born to pass the test by the brew were trained to be warriors. Pitted against hunters and water benders. And in order to become a brother you had to defeat in honorable battle 30 hunters or water benders, one hunter or water bender a day for 30 days straight. Then you were presented with a whale tooth and carved it into a scimitar with often a chiselled story of all the feats they had to do in order to make it. Then it was up to the brothers to maintain law and peace, the chief hunter made the laws and the water benders made the peace. The brothers were the ones who kept it.

Aang then said to him, "If I talk to the spirits for them to bless more children with the brotherhood. Just, please restrict their power or something. You have too corrupt an order to be keeping the laws and peace."

Sokka then said to Aang as he looked him dead in the eyes, "Aang, I could have said one word today and there would have been 40 dead earth kingdom merchants. I could have said you had a week to figure this out before I start attacking ships that enter the southern sea. But, I didn't say the word or give you a week, I kept my trap shut and gave you a month. You will drop this subject, we do not need the Avatar. The Avatar has done stuff for the world, not us. If it was not for me and my sister, you would have stayed frozen. And the world would be burned to ash by Ozai. Yet, the world seems to think low of us. Even our sister tribe thinks us weak and licking our wounds. Well guess what, we aren't. We are as strong as ever, nothing lives down here where there are little to not plants. No metals and 8 out of 11 animals here are carnivores. Nothing lives down here, they survive and nothing truly dies down here. The whale tooth slowly took shape. Little by little, Piandao shaved away the hard, white enamel, carving it and forming it. The tooth would become his weapon, his sword. It had been the living weapon of a great whale, a mighty lord of the sea, and now it would become his blade.

As he carved, Piandao allowed himself to meditate. He contemplated the nature of the whale tooth, its purpose, its contribution as a small part a great and powerful whole. Even as the brothers and sisters were each but only a single part of a whole, so too was the lone tooth only one out of many.

Alone, it was no great thing. But together with others of its kind, moving in unison with dozens of other teeth to come down upon their prey, their foes, driven by the icy, gnashing jaws of the ocean, it could become a terrible force, among the greatest in all of nature.

Piandao allowed his knife to move along the innate contours of the tooth, shaping it according to its grain, carving it not into a form he envisioned, not forcing it into a shape which he desired, but listening to the substance, the enamel, and shaping it according to its natural strengths. He did not give the tooth a form he chose -- rather, the tooth itself chose the form it would take.

He did not guide it, or lead it. He simply allowed its innate potential to come out, simply acted as the will of the substance with which he worked, shaping it according to its own native powers.

And at last it was shaped, a scimitar of the whale tooth -- as finely honed as any could manage, carved with as much skill as any of the Southern Water Tribe. Only one thing remained to finish.

A name.

It came to him easily, as naturally as if he were simply giving voice to what already existed, using a name it had always possessed.

"Ming Bo Fu," he said, half to himself, and half to the weapon in his hand. "Shining Wave Lotus. That is your name."

Looking at them and thinking about what might happen in the world soon he made a choice. He knew Aang would be leaving after the funeral rights were done. Katara was a good friend with Winona and wanted to be there for her before heading back to Air Temple Island.

Pinga came in to the hut an hour latter looking a bit down. She saw her husband looking at their new daughters.

“What’s wrong my love?” Pinga asks Sokka worried about him.

“I am going to attempt to appeal to the representatives of the republic myself. I want Notai to take charge as chief for the time being. And if I am captured tell her to not send for rescue, focus on getting the tribe ready for war. I would like it if you when to go talk to Suki to see if what she wants to do about the situation. Please bring the girls with I’m sure she would like to meet them. Bato came over earlier with Piandao they said they will go with you to guard you along with Mart, if you are willing to go that is. The trip would be after Piandao’s induction into the brotherhood is finished.” Sokka says.

“I want to do this because it’s not far of me to put so much more presser on Aang. I am chief I should appeal for our Tribe.” Sokka tells his wife.

“I will go, as will you. I know you want to do it to try to prevent your daughters from growing up in a time of war and terror like we did. I want ware this.” Pinga says as she pulls off a turtle shark tooth amulet.

“I won’t take it off I know what it means to you. It is form the first shark turtle your brother caught. You will get this back.” Sokka says.

“Katara will be here in a few minutes, let her know you’re going with them they will leave today. I’ll see you in a few weeks love.” Pinga says as she hugs her husband.
